page.title: 15PUDSEY MARKET AREA
page.content: Once held in a square,which is now a free car-park,today the market is held in a smaller area off to the side nearby.Tuesdays,Fridays and Saturdays are market days.The 30 or so stalls sell a variety of typical market produce.Not all the traders are local. Most come from other towns.They do not come only to Pudsey,but visit other local markets on other days.The Voluntary Services building,between the old and new sites,used to be the fire station and a building now converted to flats for single people was the police station. Dances,once held at the baths,also on the square, are now held at the Civic Hall.This building,together with the new police and fire stations is sited away from the town-centre in an area called Farsley near to the New Pudsey Station on the Leeds-Bradford railway line.
